ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Libretto Writing is a great intro into an often-misunderstood job. Perhaps if it were structured a little more clearly in the future it would be a more worthwhile experience. It also depends a lot on who's in the class, since it's a workshop-style seminar.

If you're interested in musical theater writing, take this course. If you don't know if you're interested in musical theater writing, take this course. If you heard a musical one time and liked it, take this course. Professor Sheinkin is an immensely gifted artist, and a highly approachable and supportive teacher. She is excited about student work and is always thrilled to share her musical theater know-how in the classroom. You will leave with skills you didn't have before, and with a real understanding of the libretto writing process.
